definition[0]: working and ready to be used
example[0]: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
example[1]: The new system became operational in March.
example[2]: Our main offices are now fully operational.
definition[1]: relating to the operation of a business, government etc
example[3]: Patco accepted full responsibility for operational management.
definition[2]: working or able to be used
example[4]: Even when the new system is fully operational it will be subject to important conditions.
example[5]: The power station will become operational next year.
example[6]: These vehicles have an operational life of five years.
definition[3]: related to the running of a business, government etc
example[7]: You will be in charge of day-to-day operational matters.

example[9]: We need to cut our operational costs in half.
